items.description: Upper Bristol Avon area
items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. River levels are now falling and we expect to remove this message in the next 24 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 13 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. No more rainfall is forecast. River levels at Torksey Gauge are falling, but still pose a flood risk at high tides. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses & plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Soar in Leicestershire
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Churn and its tributaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue overnight, 12 December 2025, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. Levels are currently high but stable. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue overnight, 12 December 2025, especially in areas closest to the river near Kidlington. The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. River levels are starting to fall very slowly. We expect levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue overnight, 12 December 2025, especially in the Woodstock area along the River Glyme.  The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. River levels have fallen below the flood risk threshold on the River Evenlode, but remain high and falling slowly on the River Glyme. We expect levels on the River Glyme to remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message:

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

River levels are falling upstream of Thame, and stable downstream of Thame. We expect levels to remain high over the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: The river level on the Wriggle, the river Cam , the River Yeo at Pen Mill have fallen. Levels remain high at Sherborne Lake remain high following rainfall on Tuesday but are falling slowly. The remainder of Friday and Saturday and Sunday will be mainly dry. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is likely in this area, including around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tern and Perry catchments
items.message: River levels remain high due to recent rainfall and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 12 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible overnight, 12 December 2025, especially in the Bourton on the Water area. The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. River levels are stable and back within banks along much of the River Dikler. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message:

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Tributaries on the Upper River Thames above Cricklade

floodArea.riverOrSea: Flagham Brook, Swill Brook, Hankerton Brook, Hykemeres Stream, Derry Brook, River Key

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible overnight, 12 December 2025, especially in the Oaksey area. The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. River levels are falling slowly and are close to being back below the flooding threshold. We expect levels to continue to fall overnight.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.description: Lower Frome and tributaries
items.message: River levels remain high at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after recent rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. The weather is set to continue to improve over the weekend. Some rain is forecast to come in Monday and Tuesday early next week. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 15 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Lugg south of Leominster
items.message: River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding is possible today, 12 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, may lead to flooding today and over the next few days. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels may remain high over the next couple of days. Avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow, Saturday 13 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following rainfall on Tuesday. As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. The remainder of Friday and Saturday and Sunday will be mainly dry. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.99m and is stable. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.28m and is falling. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Mid Bristol Avon area

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. River levels are falling and we expect to remove this alert in the next 48 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 13 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Gloucestershire
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 12 December 2025. 

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding may continue over the next few days. 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. 

Predicted peaks:- 

Mythe 3.7m to 4.1m on Saturday 13/11/25. 

Haw Bridge 4.6m to 5.0m on Saturday 13/11/25. 

No flooding is expected at other gauge locations currently. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Avon in Worcestershire
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 12 December 2025. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Avon from Abbotts Salford to Tewkesbury. Other locations that may be affected include Offenham, Evesham, Twyning and the Eckington Road. Mill Bank Road from Jubillee Bridge to Fladbury is impacted. 

River levels at the Bredon gauge peaked at 2.35m on Thursday 11/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames and tributaries from Buscot Wick down to Kings Lock
items.message:

The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. River levels have now stabilised or are falling very slowly. We expect levels to remain high over the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire, York

items.message:
"River levels remain high on the River Derwent. As a result, flooding is possible over tonight, Friday 12th December 2025 and into tomorrow, Saturday 13th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be local roads and low-lying land near rivers around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes. "

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue overnight, 12 December 2025, particularly in the areas of New Botley close to the Botley and Bulstake streams, and along the River Thames in the Wolvercote area. The forecast is for a dry night and day tomorrow, 13 December 2025. River levels are now stable through Oxford. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message:

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers in the Upper Derwent and Scarborough areas, including land around the Sea Cut at Scalby, Throxenby Beck, Old Malton, and Priorpot Beck in Norton. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Teme

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message: River levels remain high but are falling at the Leintwardine river gauge. Flooding continues. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Observed peaks: Leintwardine peaked at 1.56m at 12:30pm yesterday. River Onny forecast to rise again this afternoon. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: River levels have fallen on most rivers in West Somerset, but remain high on the Washford River, which is still above the Flood Alert level. The remainder of Friday and Saturday and Sunday will be mainly dry. Flooding is possible on low lying land and roads near the Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 13 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn Vyrnwy confluence
items.message: River levels remain high but are falling today 12 December 2025. Flooding is possible. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Peaks - Llanymynech peaked at 4.60m on Tuesday, Cae Howel peaked at 5.29m yesterday morning, 11/12. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Levels remain high today, 12th December 2025.  

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. Townfield Lane is currently impassable. We are not expecting to issue flood warnings.   

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Worcestershire
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 12 December 2025. 

Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. 

Predicted peaks:- 

Bewdley 3.4m to 3.8m Friday, 12/12/25. 

Worcester 4.0m to 4.4m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Diglis 3.7m to 4.0m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Kempsey Yacht Club 5.8m to 6.2m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Saxons Lode 4.4m to 4.8m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 12 December 2025. 

Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational. 

Predicted peak:- 

Kempsey Yacht Club 5.8m to 6.2m Saturday, 13/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ure, Swinney Beck, Bishop Monkton Beck, River Skell, River Laver, River Tutt, Stainley Beck

items.description: River Trent in Derbyshire
items.message: Due to rainfall earlier this week, river levels remain high but are lowering. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. River levels at Willington Gauge and Shardlow Gauge will continue to remain high over the next 12 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 13 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Ouse

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message:
River Ouse levels in York have peaked but remain high.  As a result, flooding is possible over tonight, Friday 12th December 2025, and into tomorrow, Saturday 13th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land in York and to the south as far as Naburn Lock, including Kings Staith, Queens Staith, and South Esplanade. River levels are falling slowly. We are closely monitoring the situation and are operating the Foss Barrier. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. 

This message will be updated by 8:00 AM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Shropshire
items.message: River levels remain high due to recent rainfall and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 12 December 2025 and may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the river from Shrewsbury to Upper Arley. Locations that may be affected are White Abbey, Coalbrookdale, Ironbridge and Bridgnorth. River Severn bank full at White Abbey, floodplain may be filling at Hayes Basin. Peaks:- Montford peaked at 5.63m overnight Wednesday 10/12, Welsh Bridge peaked at 3.22m 11/12 PM. Predicted peaks; Buildwas 4.4m to 4.5m 12/12 PM, Bridgnorth 3.5m to 3.7m 12/12 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: River Severn at Severn Ham, Tewkesbury
items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today. Flooding is expected on 12 December 2025. Flooding may affect property and roads around Mill Avon Riverside including minor roads at Tirley, Chaceley, Hasfield, Hawbridge, Lower Lode, Ashleworth, Deerhurst, Wainlode and Apperley. Predicted peak:-  Mythe 3.7m to 4.1m Saturday, 13/12/25. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Wye from Hereford to Ross-On-Wye
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area
Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Some further rainfall is expected Friday and across the weekend which may see levels react further.  Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.  We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message: River levels falling but the level of Windermere remains high following recent heavy rainfall. Avoid using low lying footpaths near watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 13/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River and lakes levels are continuing to fall, but footpaths near watercourses may still be flooded.

Further heavy rain is forecast for the weekend of 13th,14th and 15th December 2025, which will cause the rivers and lake to rise, and is likely to result in the flood warning for Keswick Campsite being reissued.

Avoid using low lying footpaths near watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 13/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Piddle and tributaries
items.message: Heavy rainfall over the last few days keeps the river level high at the Briantspuddle gauge station. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. The weather is set to continue to improve over the weekend. There is  rain forecast Tuesday next week. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Ouse at York - St George's Field and Queen's Staith
River Ouse at Naburn Lock
Lower Frome from East Stoke to Wareham
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. There is further rainfall forecast for Monday and Tuesday which may cause levels to start to rise again. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
"Levels on the Holderness Drain remain high. As a result, flooding is possible over tonight, Friday 12th December 2025 and into tomorrow, Saturday 13th December 2025.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers in the Holderness Drain area, including Leven and Bransholme. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels, operating pumping stations and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
                                                                                                                    
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes. 
"

items.message:

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Derwent at Buttercrambe Mill
items.message:
River levels remain high on the River Derwent at Buttercrambe. Levels have peaked at Buttercrambe, and will continue to slowly fall today, Friday 12th December and tomorrow, Saturday 13th December 2025. However, levels are likely to remain high into the weekend.

Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 

Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals .  

This message will be updated by 07:00am on Saturday 13th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land and property in Stamford Bridge. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

items.message: High river levels today, Friday, may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 12th December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties is not likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11:00am on Saturday 13th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. River and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. The remainder of Friday and Saturday and Sunday will be mainly dry. This flood alert will remain in force whilst levels remain high. Flooding will affect areas near the Rivers Yeo, Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain and Sowy, with low lying land and roads most affected, including Westover Trading Estate at Langport. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will commence pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 1.00PM on 13 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
